qas.question: Where did Brasilia's plan want interstate buses to stop?
What is the older interstate bus station called?
Where is the older interstate bus station?

answers.text: the western end of the Eixo Monumental

qas.question: What mall is Brasilia's newest bus station near?
What street is Brasilia's newest bus station on?
In the original plan where should western end buses stop?
Because of the location of the Parkshopping Mall, where do buses leave from today?

plausible_answers.text: on Saída Sul (South Exit) near Parkshopping Mall

qas.question: Where is the Central Station located that opened in July 2010?
What is only used to leave the Eixo Monumental?

context: In the original city plan, the interstate buses should also stop <b5_0>at the <a0_0>Central Station<b5_0/><a0_0/>. Because of the growth of Brasília (and corresponding growth in the bus fleet), today the interstate buses leave from <b6_0>the older interstate station (called <a1_0>Rodoferroviária<a1_0/>)<b6_0/>, located at <a2_0>the western end of the Eixo Monumental<a2_0/>. The Central Bus Station also contains a main metro station. A new bus station was opened <b7_0>in July 2010<b7_0/>. It is <b8_0>on <a4_0>Saída Sul<a4_0/> (South Exit) near <a3_0>Parkshopping Mall<b8_0/><a3_0/> and with its metro station, and it's also <b9_0>an inter-state bus station<b9_0/>, used only to leave the Federal District.
